channel.title: Eclipse Plugins, Bundles and Products - Eclipse Marketplace

item.title: Spring Tools 3 Add-On (aka Spring Tool Suite 3)
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Thu, 2019-04-18 04:06
Pivotal
Date Created: 
Tue, 2018-09-25 17:35
Submitted by: 
Martin Lippert

Spring Tools 3 Add-On

The Spring Tools 3 contain the previous generation Spring tooling for Eclipse, mostly focused on working with Spring apps configured using XML and providing validation support for various additional Spring projects, like Spring AOP, Spring Webflow, Spring Integration, etc. This can be installed as an add-on into the Spring Tools 4 for Eclipse as well as into a plain Eclipse installation, if you still have projects that are not migrated to Spring Boot and/or you would like to continue to use features of the previous Spring tooling generation that aren't yet been part of the all-new Spring Tools 4.

Installing this add-on pack into an existing Spring Tools 4 installation might cause a message that the "Spring Boot IDE" part of the Spring Tools 3 cannot be installed. This happens whenever you have a version of Spring Tools 4 installed that already contains a newer version of the boot dashboard feature. Just continue the installation and accept the suggested solution to install everything except the Spring Boot IDE feature.
item.dc:creator: mlippert

item.title: Spring Tools 4 - for Spring Boot (aka Spring Tool Suite 4)
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Thu, 2019-04-18 04:03
Pivotal
Date Created: 
Fri, 2014-07-11 12:41
Submitted by: 
Martin Lippert

Spring Tools 4 for Spring Boot

Spring Tools 4 is the next generation of Spring tooling for your favorite coding enrivonment. Largely rebuilt from scratch, it provides world-class support for developing Spring-Boot-based enterprise applications, whether you prefer Eclipse, Visual Studio Code, or Atom IDE.

Getting Started

Spring Tool Suite 4 makes it easy to get started. A direct and easy-to-use integration of the Spring Initializr and the famous Spring Guides allows you to go from nothing to a running Spring Boot app in seconds.

Navigate your Spring code at the speed of light

Understanding and quickly navigating source code is essential for coding. The new Spring Tools 4 understands your Spring-Boot-based source code and allows you to quickly get an overview and navigate to the important pieces of your Spring apps. Finding Spring elements and navigating to them has never been easier.

Smart Code Editing

Code completion is a critical part of working with source code. The all-new Spring Tools 4 provides smart code completions for the Spring elements in your app.

Runtime Information In Your Editor

Spring Tools 4 now bridges the gap between your source code and running Spring Boot applications. By taking advantage of the Spring Boot Actuators, we enriched the source code with detailed information from the running app (e.g., exact bean wiring information, conditional reports, configuration, details, and more).

Not working with Spring Boot yet and looking for the old Spring Tool Suite 3?

Not yet working with Spring Boot, but looking for tooling for your regular Spring projects? As long as the all-new Spring Tools 4 do not support non-boot Spring projects, please refer to the previous generation of Spring Tools for Eclipse, also known as Spring Tool Suite 3 or Spring IDE, you should look at the "Spring Tools 3 Add-On" entry in the marketplace here: https://marketplace.eclipse.org/content/spring-tools-3-add-aka-spring-tool-suite-3
item.dc:creator: mlippert

item.title: Eclipse Marketplace Client
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Wed, 2019-04-17 07:30
Eclipse.org
Date Created: 
Thu, 2018-06-07 09:13
Submitted by: 
Carsten Reckord

The Eclipse Marketplace Client is a rich client solution for installing solutions listed on Eclipse Marketplace directly from an Eclipse Installation.

The Eclipse community has hundreds, if not thousands, of third-party plugins that users can add to their Eclipse installation. Unfortunately, there is not easy way to discover and install these solutions from within Eclipse. MPC provides this tight install integration between the Eclipse workspace and Eclipse Marketplace, plus other third party solution listings.

Release Notes | Getting Started | Getting Involved

Downloads

The Marketplace Client is included in all of the EPP packages. You can use this entry to update it to the latest version.

If your Eclipse does not include the Marketplace Client already, you can install it via "Help / Install New Software ..." using one of the update sites below, matching your Eclipse release:

2019-03 | 2018-12 | 2018-09 | Photon | Oxygen | Neon | Mars
item.dc:creator: creckord

item.title: SAP Commerce Cloud (Hybris) - Developer Toolset Plugin
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Wed, 2019-04-17 07:00
EPAM Systems
Date Created: 
Mon, 2017-02-06 12:53
Submitted by: 
EPAM Systems

Ready to optimize your SAP Commerce Cloud (formerly known as SAP Hybris Commerce) development environment?

EPAM’s SAP Commerce Cloud - Developer Toolset Plugin for Eclipse enables SAP Commerce Cloud code to be imported, manipulated and worked with directly in Eclipse, resulting in enhanced productivity and code quality.

The plugin lets users work with common SAP Commerce Cloud items, such as ImpEx files and flexible search queries, directly within Eclipse. It makes it easy to import and update extensions and their dependencies into the Eclipse workspace.

The plugin offers:

  • A custom impex editing environment with built-in auto-complete that simplifies writing fresh code and ensures proper syntax
  • Easy import of specific SAP Commerce Cloud extensions, along with resolving their dependencies
  • Flexible search editing environment with auto-complete and formatting, also including the ability to execute it right against the remote server and see the result inside your IDE 
  • Quick creation and run-time of simple queries without subqueries or join statements
  • Ability to generate SAP Commerce Cloud-specific classes
  • Ability to run and validate ImpEx on remote servers
  • Solr search console which allows the execution of Solr queries directly from Eclipse
  • SAP Commerce Cloud Log Analyzer, which helps you easily troubleshoot your application in real-time
  • And much more!

Read more about SAP Commerce Cloud Developer Toolset for Eclipse

Watch the overview video about SAP Commerce Cloud Developer Toolset for Eclipse

This plugin has been created by experienced SAP Commerce Cloud developers from EPAM’s SAP Customer Experience (CX) Competency Center, the same team that brought you the #1 SAP Commerce Cloud technical blog, hybrismart.com. This plugin represents the battle-tested lessons of those developers from dozens of SAP Commerce Cloud implementations spanning platform versions (v4.x to current release), global geography, multiple industries and complex solution types (B2C, B2B, B2B2C, PIM/PCM, etc.).  

EPAM is invested in making SAP Commerce Cloud development more efficient and productive. If you have feedback, suggestions or requests, please send them to hybriseclipseplugin@epam.com.

EPAM is an SAP Platinum Partner and has created a long line of SAP Commerce Cloud-centric accelerators, extensions, connectors, microservices and plugins. Interested in getting involved and joining this global team? Learn more at https://www.epam.com/careers/hybris-talent.
item.dc:creator: esystems

item.title: Eclipse 4GL Plug-In for Eclipse
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Wed, 2019-04-17 05:22
CHILIBYTES GmbH
Date Created: 
Fri, 2015-04-17 05:22
Submitted by: 
Thomas Neumaier

The Eclipse 4GL Plug-In is developed in Java by CHILIBYTES and allows convenient editing of 4GL source code files in Eclipse. Among other features, Eclipse 4GL offers: • Syntax Highlighting • Outlining • Code Folding • Auto Completion • IntelliSense • Global Includes Direct Access Benefits Simple and fast code editing directly from inside the IDE. Multiple developers can work on the same projects. Complete versioning support in the IDE provided by the plug-in. Technical Information • Operating systems: aix, hpux, linux, macosx, qnx, solaris, win32 • Window systems: carbon, gtk, motif, photon, win32, wpf • Language support: de, de-DE, en, en-EN • Architecture: ia64, ia64_32, PA_RISC, ppc, sparc, x86, x86_64 Documentation, User Guide, Change Log Eclipse 4Gl Plug-In
item.dc:creator: cmisingname48x

item.title: Notepad4e
item.description:
Submitted by: 
Pierre-Yves B.
Date Updated: 
Tue, 2019-04-16 16:55
Date Created: 
Sat, 2016-10-08 08:14

Create highly customisable notes in Eclipse and never lose track of your thoughts, ideas or code snippets!

  • Create as many notes as you like in a dedicated Eclipse view.
  • Modify the text style (font, color, bold, italic, underlined, strikeout, etc.).
  • Customise the appearance and functionality of the plugin via its preference page.
  • Create lists of text elements.
  • Automatically save the contents of your notes to a default or custom location.
  • Use editable shortcuts to boost your productivity.
  • Export notes as text files.
  • Lightweight and user-friendly interface.
  • Source code fully available.
  • More to discover and to come in future updates!

Notepad4e is free, without ads and open-source. Support the project by starring it on the marketplace and/or on GitHub!
item.dc:creator: pybigourdan

item.title: Eclipse Java EE Developer Tools
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Tue, 2019-04-16 15:58
The Eclipse Foundation
Date Created: 
Wed, 2016-07-06 21:31
Submitted by: 
Nitin Dahyabhai

Enables Enterprise Java Bean, Java Enterprise Application, Fragments, and Connector, Java Web Application, JavaServer Faces (JSF), Java Server Pages (JSP), Java Servlet, Java Web Services, and Tag Library development and debugging, plus Java Enterprise server, Java Servlet Container, and Java Application launching and debugging. Includes the JSP, HTML, CSS, and JSON Editors, JavaScript Developer Tools, the XML, XML Schema, XML Stylesheet, and DTD Editors from the Eclipse Web Tools Platform project.

If you're developing web applications with a Java-based back-end, this one's for you.
item.dc:creator: nitind

item.title: Design and Verification Tools (DVT) IDE for e, SystemVerilog, VHDL, and PSS
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Tue, 2019-04-16 15:11
AMIQ EDA
Date Created: 
Wed, 2006-04-19 08:00
Submitted by: 
AMIQ Support

Design and Verification Tools (DVT) is an integrated development environment (IDE) for the design and verification engineers working with SystemVerilog, Verilog, VHDL, e, UPF, CPF, SLN, PSS, SDL. Including Universal Verification Methodology (UVM) support. It is similar to well-known programming tools like Visual Studio®, NetBeans®, and IntelliJ®. DVT comprises a proprietary IEEE standard-compliant parser, a smart code editor, an intuitive GUI, a comprehensive set of features that help with code inspection, navigation, documentation, and debugging, and an innovative linting framework. DVT allows design and verification engineers to overcome the limitations of plain text editors and use a modern and powerful tool that enables them to:

  • Increase the speed and quality of new code development
  • Easily understand complex or poorly documented source code
  • Simplify the maintenance of legacy code and reusable libraries
  • Accelerate language and methodology learning
  • Automatically generate well-organized source code documentation

 

FEATURES Some of the features that DVT offers include:

  • Compilation errors signaled on the fly
  • Autocomplete / Content Assist
  • Customizable code and project templates
  • Dedicated wizards to generate getters and setters, override functions, or help with UVM factory registration
  • Hyperlinks
  • Semantic Search and Show Usages
  • Quick fixes / Autocorrect
  • Refactoring
  • Macro expansion
  • Project database query views (types, macros, checks, etc.)
  • Structural views (type hierarchy, design hierarch, call hierarchy, etc.)
  • Signal tracing
  • UML and TLM diagrams for inspecting and documenting the verification environment
  • Schematic, trace, state machine diagrams for inspecting and documenting the design
  • Dedicated UVM support
  • Cross-language capabilities for mixed-language projects
  • In-line reminders for task tracking (TO DOs)
  • Vi and emacs emulation

 

INTEGRATION WITH OTHER TOOLS Since it is built on the Eclipse Platform, the DVT IDE can be easily integrated within a large plug-in ecosystem. It also integrates seamlessly with all major hardware simulators such as NCSim , Specman , VCS , and Questa, to enable simplified simulation analysis and debugging. In addition, it works with revision control systems like CVS, Git, Subversion, ClearCase and bug tracking systems such as Bugzilla and ClearQuest.
RESOURCES

 

  • DVT Eclipse IDE Web Page
  • DVT Eclipse IDE Datasheet
  • Demo movies
  • DVT Debugger Add-on
item.dc:creator: emisingname6ia

item.title: Synopsys Code Sight
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Tue, 2019-04-16 12:47
Synopsys Inc
Date Created: 
Fri, 2019-02-15 16:30
Submitted by: 
Synopsys Code Sight

The Synopsys® Code Sight™ plug-in helps identify quality bugs and security vulnerabilities in your software.

Using the Coverity Static Analysis tool, it automatically scans your code for these types of issues and highlights them in the development-environment editor as you code.

Connecting to a Synopsys server improves scan performance and enables your entire development team to collaborate on writing better code faster.

In the future, the plug-in will support our other tools including Black Duck for SCA & Seeker for IAST.

See what the plug-in looks like in our interactive demo: Code Sight Quick Tour

A functional Coverity license is required to run Code Sight. Please check with your local administrator or contact  sales@synopsys.com.

Documentation for Installation, Getting Started, etc. can be found here: https://community.synopsys.com/s/code-sight-hub

Please click here to read the Synopsys End User License Agreement.
item.dc:creator: scodesight

item.title: Groovy Development Tools
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Tue, 2019-04-16 11:42
Pivotal
Date Created: 
Wed, 2012-07-04 13:05
Submitted by: 
Andrew Clement

The Groovy Development Tools (GDT) provides Eclipse and Maven (m2e) support for the Apache Groovy programming language. GDT adds full-featured IDE support including editors, wizards, content assist, debugging, refactoring and searching.

The GDT requires the Eclipse Java Development Tools (JDT) as it builds upon Java/JVM support, including Java interoperability (bi-directional dependencies via joint compilation). If your Eclipse flavor does not include JDT, you must install it first.

GDT does not provide any direct support for Grails. If you want Grails tooling, then please consider Groovy-Grails Tools Suite or spring-projects/grails-ide for your Grails projects.
item.dc:creator: aclement
